body_html: As Derek mentioned, currently we don't have a mechanism for specifying if some outputs should be in host memory and we assume (to a large extent) that they'd be in device memory. Strings can't be in device memory, hence the bug. I shall work on having a dynamic method of identifying which outputs should be allocated on the host / device. Stay tuned for a fix in a bit.

body: As Derek mentioned, currently we don't have a mechanism for specifying if some outputs should be in host memory and we assume (to a large extent) that they'd be in device memory. Strings can't be in device memory, hence the bug. I shall work on having a dynamic method of identifying which outputs should be allocated on the host / device. Stay tuned for a fix in a bit.
